page.title: 18Names in Haverfordwest.
page.content: There was once a ford across the Cleddau at low tide. Haverford possibly meant Ford used by the he goats and may be connected with Goat street. Other possibilities link it with Scandinavian origin,Hafna's Fjord or Hrafn's Fjord.There has also been mention of a connection with Hereford hence the 'West'. Dew street was once Dewy street Welsh for St.David's street.Other self explanatory names are Quay St., Barn St., Bridge St., Market St. Roads leading out of town signify direction.Dale Road, Haven Road, Fishguard Road. Several roads are linked to the Old Priory: Priory Road, Abbot's Close, Augustine Way. Farm names include Dairypark, Skerryford, Light-a-Pipe, Haroldston, Fern Hill and Haylett.
